bkietz commented on issue #6556: ARROW-2255: [C++][Developer][Integration] Serialize custom field/schema metadata
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6556#issuecomment-596510532
 
 
   JavaScript and Go are disabled. If enabled:
   
   `c++, Java -> Go` fail; Go reader [complains metadata is absent](https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6556/checks?check_run_id=492367610#step:5:2508)
   
   `JS, Go -> c++, Java` fail; Both readers [complain metadata is absent](https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6556/checks?check_run_id=492367610#step:5:2961)
   
   `c++, Java -> JS` pass
   
   `JS, Go -> JS, Go` pass

bkietz commented on pull request #6556: ARROW-2255: [C++][Developer][Integration] Serialize custom field/schema metadata
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6556#discussion_r391905389
 
 

 ##########
 File path: dev/archery/archery/integration/datagen.py
 ##########
 @@ -1113,6 +1163,10 @@ def _temp_path():
 
         generate_nested_case(),
 
+        generate_custom_metadata_case().skip_category('Go')
+                                       .skip_category('Java')
+                                       .skip_category('JS'),
+
 
 Review comment:
   @wesm I have skipped everybody but C++ due to incompatible serialization of custom_metadata. I assumed that this would exclude Java from all test involving custom_metadata, but it seems Java is still trying to test Flight https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6556/checks?check_run_id=504218272#step:5:3445
   
   I can add `.skip_category(SKIP_FLIGHT)` but that seems incorrect (C++ <-> C++ should still be testable through flight). Am I missing something?

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description: I don't believe we are doing this at present. We should validate that each implementation properly handles the incoming metadata from other Arrow emitters
fields.summary: [Developer][Integration] Serialize schema- and field-level custom metadata in integration test JSON format

comments.body: [~emkornfield@gmail.com] handling of Schema and Field {{custom_metadata}} is pretty inconsistent. To assert this is properly handled we would need to add it to the integration test JSON format
agreed.  I'll try to make this happen for 1.0.0.
Looks like this is nearly done. I will review when I can
